member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection
member.summary: This interfaces extends the generic CBAM interface to provide SQL-specific functionality in addition to generic functionality. Furthermore, all generic type arguments of are bound to those that also provide SQL-specialization, and enables to use this interface for any SQL processing, regardless of vendor.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection.DatabaseMetadata
member.summary: Gets the object describing the database this is connected to.
member.value: The object describing the database this is connected to.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection.GetReadOnlyAsync
member.summary: Potentially asynchronously gets the value indicating whether this is read-only, .
member.returns: A task which on completion will have value indicating whether this is read-only.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection.SetReadOnlyAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Asynchronously sets the value indicating whether this is read-only.
member.param: Whether this connection should be read-only.
member.returns: A task which on completion has set the value indicating whether this is read-only. The returned value of the task should always be 1.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection.GetDefaultTransactionIsolationLevelAsync
member.summary: Potentially asynchronously gets the value indicating current transaction isolation level.
member.returns: A task which on completion will have value indicating current transaction isolation level.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection.SetDefaultTransactionIsolationLevelAsync(CBAM.SQL.TransactionIsolationLevel)
member.summary: Asynchronously sets the value indicating current transaction isolation level.
member.param: The new transaction isolation level.
member.returns: A task which on completion has set the value indicating current transaction isolation level. The returned value of the task should always be 1.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection.ProcessStatementResultPassively(UtilPack.MemorizingPotentiallyAsyncReader{System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Char},CBAM.SQL.SQLStatementBuilderInformation,CBAM.SQL.SQLStatementExecutionResult)
member.summary: Given current and context of reading SQL from some source (), processes the result passively (no user input). This is used by method which is equivalent to running SQL dump from file to database.
member.param: The source where SQL statement originated.
The about current statement.
The encountered when enumerating returned by .
member.returns: A task which should return true on completion if anything was done to .

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnectionVendorFunctionality
member.summary: This interface extends generic CBAM interface to provide SQL-specific functionality common for all SQL vendors. This functionality has mostly to do with SQL syntax.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnectionVendorFunctionality.EscapeLiteral(System.String)
member.summary: Given a string, escapes any characters in it so that it can be interpreted as literal string in this SQL vendor.
member.param: The string to escape. May be null.
member.returns: Escaped string.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnectionVendorFunctionality.TryAdvanceReaderOverSingleStatement(UtilPack.PeekablePotentiallyAsyncReader{System.Nullable{System.Char}})
member.summary: Given a (which can wrap a normal ), tries to advance it over a single, complete SQL statement.
member.param: The reader to advance.
member.returns: A task which will complete after advance is over. Return value is currently not used, since does not exist as non-generic version.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnectionVendorFunctionality.CanTrimBegin(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if given character is ignored when it appears at start of SQL string.
member.param: The character to check.
member.returns: true if is ignored when it appears at start of SQL string.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.SQLConnectionVendorFunctionality.CanTrimEnd(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if given character is ignored when it appears at end of SQL string.
member.param: The character to check.
member.returns: true if is ignored when it appears at end of SQL string.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.TransactionIsolationLevel
member.summary: This enumeration describes the transaction isolation levels in relational databases.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.TransactionIsolationLevel.ReadUncommitted
member.summary: Indicates the READ UNCOMMITTED isolation level.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.TransactionIsolationLevel.ReadCommitted
member.summary: Indicates the READ COMMITTED isolation level.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.TransactionIsolationLevel.RepeatableRead
member.summary: Indicates the REPEATABLE READ isolation level.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.TransactionIsolationLevel.Serializable
member.summary: Indicates the SERIALIZABLE isolation level.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.SQLStatementExecutionResult
member.summary: This is common interface for items enumerated by returned by method of .

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.SQLStatementExecutionResult.Warnings
member.summary: Gets the warnings issued by backend during last call of .
member.value: The warnings issued by backend during last call of .

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.SingleCommandExecutionResult
member.summary: This interface extends to provide additional information when backend has finished executing one SQL statement (SQL string may contain multiple statements).

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.SingleCommandExecutionResult.AffectedRows
member.summary: Gets the amount of rows affected by the single SQL statement.
member.value: The amount of rows affected by the single SQL statement.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.SingleCommandExecutionResult.CommandTag
member.summary: Gets the vendor-specific command tag string (e.g. "INSERT", "UPDATE" etc) of the executed SQL statement.
member.value: The vendor-specific command tag string (e.g. "INSERT", "UPDATE" etc) of the executed SQL statement.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.BatchCommandExecutionResult
member.summary: This interface extends to provide additional information when backend has finished executing a batch of SQL statement with various parameters.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.BatchCommandExecutionResult.AffectedRows
member.summary: Gets the amount of rows affected by each executed SQL statement.
member.value: The amount of rows affected by each executed SQL statement.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.BatchCommandExecutionResult.CommandTag
member.summary: Gets the vendor-specific command tag string (e.g. "INSERT", "UPDATE" etc) of the executed SQL statement.
member.value: The vendor-specific command tag string (e.g. "INSERT", "UPDATE" etc) of the executed SQL statement.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.SQLDataRow
member.summary: This interface extends to provide additional information about single row sent by backend as a result of "SELECT" statement. Furthermore, this interface extends to provide access to the columns of the data row.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.WhenExceptionInMultipleStatements
member.summary: This enumeration is used by and extension methods to control how the method behaves when an exception is occurred in statement result processing.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.WhenExceptionInMultipleStatements.Rethrow
member.summary: This value indicates that an exception should be simply re-thrown.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.WhenExceptionInMultipleStatements.Continue
member.summary: This value indicates that exception should be ignored, and current transaction should be rollbacked (no SQL command is executed on error, as the transaction is automatically rollbacked when an error occurs). The SQL statement processing will continue.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.WhenExceptionInMultipleStatements.RollbackAndStartNew
member.summary: This value indicates that exception should be ignored, and new transaction should be started (current transaction is automatically rollbacked when an error occurs, and SQL statement to start new transaction ("BEGIN TRANSACTION") is issued). The SQL statement processing will continue.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseMetadata
member.summary: This interface contains all API related to metadata of the database that is currently connected to.
member.remarks:
While the API exposed directly by this interface can be used, in most scenarios, the actual usage happens through extension methods:
,
,
,
,
, and
.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseMetadata.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the database that the is connected to.
member.value: The name of the database that the is connected to.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseMetadata.CreateSchemaSearch(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new which contains information for executing schema search with given schema name pattern.
member.param: The schema name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on schema name.
member.returns: An which can be used to search the schema information from the database.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseMetadata.CreateTableSearch(System.String,System.String,CBAM.SQL.TableType[])
member.summary: Creates a new which contains information for executing table search with given search parameters.
member.param: The schema name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on schema name.
The table name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on table name.
The table types. If not null and not empty, can be used to further narrow down search results based on table type.
member.returns: An which can be used to search the table information from the database.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseMetadata.CreateColumnSearch(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new which contains information for executing table column search with given search parameters.
member.param: The schema name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on schema name.
The table name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on table name.
The column name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on table column name.
member.returns: An which can be used to search the table column information from the database.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseMetadata.CreatePrimaryKeySearch(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new which contains information for executing table primary key search with given search parameters.
member.param: The schema name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on schema name.
The table name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on table name.
member.returns: An which can be used to search the table primary key information from the database.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseMetadata.CreateForeignKeySearch(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new which contains information for executing table foreign key search with given search parameters.
member.param: The schema name of the table containing primary key. If not null, will narrow down search results based on primary key table schema name.
The name of the table containing primary key. If not null, will narrow down search results based on primary key table name.
The schema name of the table containing foreign key. If not null, will narrow down search results based on foreign key table schema name.
The name of the table containing foreign key. If not null, will narrow down search results based on foreign key table name.
member.returns: An which can be used to search the table foreign key information from the database.

member.summary: This method will create a new based on resulted from executing query produced by .
member.param: The data row encountered during processing query produced by .
member.returns: A task which will on completion result in object.
member.remarks: Using this method on a which originates from other then the one returned by will most likely result in errors.

member.summary: Gets the textual comment associated with this database metadata object.

member.summary: This is common interface for database metadata objects which have some sort of type name.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseElementWithTypeName.TypeName
member.summary: Gets the textual type name of this database metadata object.
member.value: The textual type name of this database metadata object.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.TableMetadata
member.summary: This interface contains information about a single table in the database.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.TableMetadata.TableType
member.summary: Gets the type of the table as enumeration.
member.value: The type of the table as enumeration.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseElementWithColumnName
member.summary: This is common interface for database metadata objects which have column name.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseElementWithColumnName.ColumnName
member.summary: Gets the name of the column this database metadata object belongs to.
member.value: The name of the column this database metadata object belongs to.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseElementWithOrdinalPosition
member.summary: This is common interface for database metadata objects which are contained within some other object (e.g. column in a table) and have ordinal position.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.DatabaseElementWithOrdinalPosition.OrdinalPosition
member.summary: Gets the zero-based ordinal position of this database metadata object within parent object.
member.value: The zero-based ordinal position of this database metadata object within parent object.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.ColumnMetadata
member.summary: This interface contains information about single column of a single table in the database.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.ColumnMetadata.DecimalDigits
member.summary: Gets the amount of decimal digits, if applicable.
member.value: The amount of decimal digits, if applicable.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.ColumnMetadata.Nullable
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether this column accepts NULLs as valid values.
member.value: The value indicating whether this column accepts NULLs as valid values.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.ColumnMetadata.ColumnDefaultValue
member.summary: Gets the column default value, if any.
member.value: The column default value, if any.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.ColumnMetadata.ColumnCLRType
member.summary: Gets the column CLR type, if it can be deducted at runtime.
member.value: The column CLR type, if it can be deducted at runtime.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.ColumnMetadata.IsPrimaryKeyColumn
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether this column is primary key column.
member.value: The value indicating whether this column is primary key column.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.KeyMetadataInfo
member.summary: This is common interface for direct and indirect primary and foreign key information in the database.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.KeyMetadataInfo.KeyName
member.summary: Gets the name of this primary or foreign key information.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.KeyMetadata
member.summary: This is common interface for direct primary and foreign key information in the database.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.KeyMetadata.Deferrability
member.summary: Gets the of this primary or foreign key information, if it exists.
member.value: The of this primary or foreign key information, if it exists.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.PrimaryKeyMetadata
member.summary: This interface contains information about single primary key column of a single table in the database.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.ForeignKeyMetadata
member.summary: This interface contains information about single foreign key column of a single table in the database.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.ForeignKeyMetadata.PrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets the information about the primary key column that this this foreign key column references.
member.value: The information about the primary key column that this this foreign key column references.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.ForeignKeyMetadata.OnUpdate
member.summary: Gets the of this foreign key constraint for update action, if any.
member.value: The of this foreign key constraint for update action, if any.

member.name: P:CBAM.SQL.ForeignKeyMetadata.OnDelete
member.summary: Gets the of this foreign key constraint for delete action, if any.
member.value: The of this foreign key constraint for delete action, if any.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.ReferentialAction
member.summary: This enumeration contains possible values for SQL actions when the target of the foreign key changes (ON UPDATE) or gets deleted (ON DELETE).

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.ReferentialAction.Cascade
member.summary: The foreign key will be updated to new value in case of change, and the row will be deleted in case of deletion.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.ReferentialAction.SetNull
member.summary: The foreign key will be set to NULL value if the target changes or gets deleted.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.ReferentialAction.SetDefault
member.summary: The foreign key will be set to default values if the target changes or gets deleted.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.ReferentialAction.Restrict
member.summary: The change or deletion of the target will cause an error in that statement.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.ReferentialAction.NoAction
member.summary: A lot like , this will cause an error if the target gets changed or deleted, but the check is done only only at the very end of the statement, after triggers and other mechanisms have been processed. This means that even with deletion or change, the end-state might be acceptable, valid foreign key references.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.ConstraintCharacteristics
member.summary: This enumeraton contains possible values for SQL constraint (e.g. PRIMARY KEY, FOREIGN KEY, etc) characteristics.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.ConstraintCharacteristics.InitiallyImmediate_Deferrable
member.summary: The constraint is immediate by default, but may be deferred on demand when needed.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.ConstraintCharacteristics.InitiallyDeferred_Deferrable
member.summary: The constraint is always deferred.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.ConstraintCharacteristics.NotDeferrable
member.summary: The constraint is always immediate.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.TableType
member.summary: This enumeration specifies for possible table types in table search of and methods.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.TableType.Table
member.summary: This value represents normal SQL table.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.TableType.View
member.summary: This value represents a SQL view.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.TableType.SystemTable
member.summary: This value represents a system table, aka catalog.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.TableType.GlobalTemporary
member.summary: This value represents global temporary table.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.TableType.LocalTemporary
member.summary: This value represents local temporary table.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.TableType.Synonym
member.summary: This value represents a synonym table.

member.name: F:CBAM.SQL.TableType.MaxValue
member.summary: This value represents the maximum value of this enumeration, and can be used in other enumerations which 'extend' this one.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.CBAMExtensions
member.summary: This class contains extension methods for types defined in other assemblies, or rarely used extension methods for types defined in this assembly.

member.summary: Creates a new which can be used to execute schema search with given schema name pattern.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.CBAMExtensions.GetExportedForeignKeyMetadataAsync(CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This is shortcut method to enumerate all foreign key columns of given table, and return the column information in a list.
member.param: This .
The schema name of the table to get foreign keys from.
The table name of the table to get foreign keys from.
member.returns: Asynchronously returns list of objects that have information about foreign key columns of the given table.
member.remarks: Since this method stores all results in a single , use this when it is not expected to return a very large sets of data.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.CBAMExtensions.GetImportedForeignKeyMetadataAsync(CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This is shortcut method to enumerate all foreign key columns of other tables that reference primary key of given table, and return the column information in a list.
member.param: This .
The schema name of the table that other foreign keys reference.
The table name of the table that other foreign keys reference.
member.returns: Asynchronously returns list of objects that have information about foreign key columns of other tables that reference given table.
member.remarks: Since this method stores all results in a single , use this when it is not expected to return a very large sets of data.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.CBAMExtensions.GetSchemaMetadataAsync(CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection,System.String)
member.summary: This is shortcut method to enumerate all schemas, with given optional schema name filter, in the database, and return the schema information in a list.
member.param: This .
The schema name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on schema name.
member.returns: Asynchronously returns list of objects that have information about schema in the database.
member.remarks: Since this method stores all results in a single , use this when it is not expected to return a very large sets of data.

The schema name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on schema name.
The table name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on table name.
The table types. If not null and not empty, can be used to further narrow down search results based on table type.
member.returns: Asynchronously returns list of objects that have information about table in the database.
member.remarks: Since this method stores all results in a single , use this when it is not expected to return a very large sets of data.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.CBAMExtensions.GetColumnMetadataAsync(CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection,System.String,System.String,System.String)

The schema name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on schema name.

member.param: This .
The schema name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on schema name.
The table name pattern. If not null, will narrow down search results based on table name.
member.returns: Asynchronously returns list of objects that have information about primary key column in the database.
member.remarks: Since this method stores all results in a single , use this when it is not expected to return a very large sets of data.

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.CBAMExtensions.GetCrossReferenceMetadataAsync(CBAM.SQL.SQLConnection,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This is shortcut method to enumerate all foreign key columns, with given primary and foreign table schema name and table name filters, in the database, and return the foreign key column information in a list.

The primary table schema name. If not null, will narrow down search results based on primary table's schema name.
The primary table table name. If not null, will narrow down search results based on primary table's table name.
The foreign table schema name. If not null, will narrow down search results based on foreign table's schema name.
The foreign table table name. If not null, will narrow down search results based on foreign table's table name.
member.returns: Asynchronously returns list of objects that have information about foreign key column in the database.
member.remarks: Since this method stores all results in a single , use this when it is not expected to return a very large sets of data.

member.name: T:CBAM.SQL.SQLException
member.summary: This class is common base class for all exceptions which signal some sort of SQL error in syntax or backend processing.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of with given message and optional inner exception.
member.param: The error message.
The optional inner exception.

member.summary: This interface provides read-only API for .

member.name: M:CBAM.SQL.SQLStatementBuilderInformation.GetBatchParameterInfo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets information about parameter which has been previously added to batch of parameters.

member.summary: This method can be used to read SQL statements from stream (e.g. a file) and passively process each statement with this until the last statement is done processing.
member.param: This .
The containing the SQL statements.
The to use when reading textual SQL statemetns from . If null, a new instance of which does not emit nor throw will be used.

The amount of characters to read for one statement until the buffer is cleared. This does not mean the maximum size for statement, instead it indicates that if after processing a single SQL statement, if the buffer is higher than this number, then it will be cleared.
The amount bytes to read in one chunk from given .
Optional callback to react when occurs during passive processing of single SQL statement. It should return , or be left out, in which case behaviour pattern will be used.
Optional to use when creating .
member.returns: A task which will on completion return amount of statements read.
